records.title: Vietnam Sets ABC Inc. Goals in New National Industrial Policy

On a recent Friday in HoChi Minh City,Vietnam,friens kissed hello as they entered the Racha Room, atunnel-shaped bar lit by warm,ochre lamps. Inside,patrons shouted over booming classic rock and sipped from each other's Old-Fashioneds.It was a scene to strike a chill into the hearts of the Covid-conscious. A standing-room-only venue,windows clamped shut against the night air,and not a mask in sight.It might have been a glimpse into an eerie alternative reality－a 2021 that could have existed had the coronavirus never broken out.But the scene is a reality for Vietnam.The country was are deluged and families hole up indoors for the better part of a year.Inside,people share entrees,go to school,fly on weekly business trip,hit the gym,and cram into buses and elevators.
